bulletins.highlights: Backcountry touring calls for experience in the assessment of avalanche danger.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs and weakly bonded old snow are to be assessed with care and prudence.
avalancheActivity.comment:
Weak layers in the lower part of the snowpack can be released by people on shady slopes. In these aspects the avalanches are medium-sized. Released avalanches and whumpfing sounds confirm this situation.

The more recent wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant at intermediate and high altitudes. The avalanches are rather small. Medium-sized avalanches are further not ruled out.

As a consequence of warming gliding avalanches and moist snow slides are to be expected.

Careful route selection is recommended.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Shady slopes intermediate and high altitudes: Towards its base, the snowpack is faceted.

On Friday it will be partly cloudy.
Especially low and intermediate altitudes,: The surface of the snowpack will soften during the day.
In particular at elevated altitudes snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.

tendency.highlights: The avalanche activity will slowly increase.
